alert.note: Alert for Bullitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Bullitt. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The Bullitt County Kentucky Mesonet station 6 miles southeast of Shepherdsville reported 1.41 inches of rain in 30 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shepherdsville, Pioneer Village, Mount Washington, Hillview, Lebanon Junction, Hebron Estates, Fox Chase, Hunters Hollow, Cedar Grove and Clermont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
